docs.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL -- Gov. Sarah Palin of Alaska, Senator John McCain's running mate, didn't make it to a rally here being held by Phyllis Schlafly, the doyenne of the conservative movement and a long-time opponent of abortion rights.

headline.main: Talk Radio Host Slams Media, Palin Critics

docs.abstract: At a conservative women's event, Laura Ingraham blasts the media coverage of the Alaska governor, tying it to a liberal bias over issues like abortion.
docs.snippet: At a conservative women's event, Laura Ingraham blasts the media coverage of the Alaska governor, tying it to a liberal bias over issues like abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Times's Kim Severson talked with Alaskans about the disclosure that Gov. Sarah Palin's unmarried teenage daughter is pregnant.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dan Schnur, the director of the Jesse M. Unruh Institute of Politics at the University of Southern California, was the national communications director for John McCain's presidential campaign in 2000. (Full biography.)

headline.main: The G.O.P. Goal: Get Through Tuesday

docs.abstract: It's been a crazy news cycle. And for the Republicans, getting through Tuesday is key.
docs.snippet: It's been a crazy news cycle. And for the Republicans, getting through Tuesday is key.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEERFIELD BEACH, Fla. - Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr., the Democratic vice-presidential nominee, must have known it was coming, but he still sought divine intercession before tackling the question.
docs.abstract: Campaigning in Deerfield Beach, Fla., Senator Biden was asked about Gov. Sarah Palin and her daughter's pregnancy.
docs.snippet: Campaigning in Deerfield Beach, Fla., Senator Biden was asked about Gov. Sarah Palin and her daughter's pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL -- While aides to the McCain campaign fanned out across the airwaves this morning to deal with the fallout from the revelations regarding Gov. Sarah Palin, convention planners prepared to retool some of the planned schedule now that Hurricane Gustav's threat has dissipated a bit.

headline.main: The Early Word: Palin Dominates Convention Talk

docs.abstract: Some convention speakers are back on the schedule, and others may be shifted around, but the main discussion still centers on the G.O.P.'s No. 2 candidate, Governor Palin, and all the revelations about her that have spilled out in recent days.
docs.snippet: Some convention speakers are back on the schedule, and others may be shifted around, but the main discussion still centers on the G.O.P.'s No. 2 candidate, Governor Palin, and all the revelations about her that have spilled out in recent days.

byline.original: By KATE PHILLIPS AND MICHAEL FALCONE

docs.lead_paragraph: More of your "late night" jokes (use the comment link below):
docs.abstract: More of your "late night" jokes (use the comment link below): Cable TV was dominated by two major news, Sarah Palin's daughter's pregnancy and Hurricane Gustav. docs.lead_paragraph: The Sarah Palin pick allows John McCain to run the way he wants to — not as the old goat running against the upstart, but as the crusader for virtue against the forces of selfishness.
